column4: that has the effect of running the script in the interpreter that is specified in that first line
and the point of using #! is that those interpreters that use it use # for comments
that includes sh, bash, perl, python, ruby, ...
and yes that is the technical term for it
magic cookie applies to the first two bytes of any *nix executable file
the shebang is one of the magic cookies that linux recognizes
note that i have only just installed ubuntu for the first time
how else can you install gentoo other than by hand
